cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 mi southwest of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest through the eastern Gulf of Mexico and expected to recurve northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle or Big Bend coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border to the Mississippi-Alabama border (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Mississippi–Alabama coast; Hurricane Watch begins east of Alabama-Florida border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Florida Big Bend and inland across the southeastern United States
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (18% cumulative) of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds late Tuesday night through Wednesday; peak onset probability 9% around 72 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge currently forecast for Mississippi coast; main surge threat east of Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible, but widespread totals >4 inches are not expected for coastal Mississippi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the Mississippi barrier islands and approaches to the port.
